.zip";s:5:"5.2.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.2.0.zip";s:5:"5.3.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.3.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.4.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.4.1.zip";s:5:"5.5.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.5.0.zip";s:5:"5.6.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.6.0.zip";s:5:"5.6.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.6.1.zip";s:5:"5.6.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.6.2.zip";s:5:"5.7.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.7.0.zip";s:5:"5.8.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.8.0.zip";s:5:"5.8.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.8.1.zip";s:5:"5.9.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.0.zip";s:5:"5.9.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.1.zip";s:5:"5.9.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.2.zip";s:5:"5.9.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.3.zip";s:5:"5.9.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.4.zip";s:5:"5.9.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.5.zip";s:5:"5.9.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.5.9.6.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:62:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"https://paypal.me/anovladimir";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1760590";s:2:"2x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1760590";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:20:"Fast Velocity Minify";s:4:"slug";s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.8.9";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://fastvelocity.com">Raul Peixoto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.4.4";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:94;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:154;i:4;i:4;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:4;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:170;s:15:"support_threads";i:15;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:6;s:10:"downloaded";i:2146787;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2020-06-22 7:40pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-06-21";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://fastvelocity.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3875:"<p>WP speed optimization plugin for developers and advanced users. This plugin reduces HTTP requests by merging CSS &amp; Javascript files into groups of files, while attempting to use the least amount of files as possible. It minifies CSS and JS files with PHP Minify (no extra requirements).</p>
<p>Minification is done on the frontend during the first uncached request. Once the first request is processed, any other pages that require the same set of CSS and JavaScript files, will be served that same (static) cache file.</p>
<p>This plugin includes options for developers and advanced users, however the default settings should work just fine for most sites.<br />
Kindly read our faqs about possible issues with you theme or specific plugins.</p>
<h4>Aditional Optimization</h4>
<p>I can offer you aditional <code>custom made</code> optimization on top of this plugin. If you would like to hire me, please visit my profile links for further information.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Merge JS and CSS files into groups to reduce the number of HTTP requests</li>
<li>Google Fonts merging, inlining and optimization</li>
<li>Handles scripts loaded both in the header &amp; footer separately</li>
<li>Keeps the order of the scripts even if you exclude some files from minification</li>
<li>Supports localized scripts (https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_localize_script)</li>
<li>Minifies CSS and JS with PHP Minify only, no third party software or libraries needed.</li>
<li>Option to defer JavaScript and CSS files, either globally or pagespeed insights only.</li>
<li>Creates static cache files in the uploads directory.</li>
<li>Preserves your original files, by duplicating and copying those files to the uploads directory </li>
<li>View the status and detailed logs on the WordPress admin page.</li>
<li>Option to Minify HTML, remove extra info from the header and other optimizations.</li>
<li>Ability to turn off minification for JS, CSS or HTML (purge the cache to see it)</li>
<li>Ability to turn off CSS or JS merging completely (so you can debug which section causes conflicts and exclude the offending files)</li>
<li>Ability to manually ignore JavaScript or CSS files that conflict when merged together (please report if you find some)</li>
<li>Support for conditional scripts and styles, as well as inlined code that depends on the handles</li>
<li>Support for multisite installations (each site has its own settings)</li>
<li>Support for gzip_static on Nginx</li>
<li>Support for preconnect and preload headers</li>
<li>CDN option, to rewrite all static assets inside the JS or CSS files</li>
<li>WP CLI support to check stats and purge the cache</li>
<li>Auto purging of cache files for W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Cache (by Till Krüss ), SG Optimizer, HyperCache, Cache Enabler, Breeze (Cloudways), Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine (read the FAQs)</li>
<li>and some more&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>WP-CLI Commands</h4>
<ul>
<li>Purge all caches: <code>wp fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on the entire network (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Get cache size: <code>wp fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on each site (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm stats</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>The JavaScript minification is by <a href="https://github.com/matthiasmullie/minify" rel="nofollow ugc">PHP Minify</a></li>
<li>Compatible with Nginx, HHVM and PHP 7</li>
<li>Minimum requirements are PHP 5.5 and WP 4.4, from version 1.4.0 onwards</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:318:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:14355:"
<h4>
Can I update plugins and themes after installing FVM?
</h4>
<p>
<p>FVM doesn&#8217;t touch your original files. It copies those files to the cache directory, minifies that copy and merges them together under a different name. If you install new plugins, change themes or do plugin updates, FVM will purge its cache as well as some of the most popular cache plugins.</p>
</p>
<h4>
After installing, why did my site feels slow to load?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Please see the question below.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why are there lots of JS and CSS files listed on the status page and why is the cache directory taking so much space?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Some themes combine and enqueue their CSS using a PHP script with a query string that changes on every pageload&#8230; (this is to bust cache, but it&#8217;s bad practice since it prevents caching at all). When FVM sees a different url being enqueued, it will consider that as a new file and try to create a new set of files on every pageview as well. You must then exclude that dynamic url via the Ignore List on the settings for your cache to be efficient and stop growing. Also note, if your pages enqueue different styles or  javascript in different pages (fairly common), that is &#8220;one set&#8221; of files to be merged. Pay attention to the logs header and look for the page url where those files have ben generated. If you have multiple files generated for the same url, you have some css/js that keeps changing on every pageview (and thus needs exclusion).</p>
</p>
<h4>
How can I exclude certain assets?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Each line on the ignore list will try to match a substring against all CSS or JS files, for example <code>//yoursite.com/wp-content/plugins/some-plugin/js/</code> will ignore all files inside that directory. You can also shorten the URL like <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> and then it will match any css or js URL that has <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> on the path. Obviously, doing <code>/js/</code> would match any files inside any &#8220;/js/&#8221; directory and in any location, so to avoid unexpected situations please always use the longest, most specific path you can use. There is no need to use asterisks or regex code (it won&#8217;t work).</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why is the ignore list not working?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The ignore list &#8220;is&#8221; working, just try to use partial paths (see previous faq) and use relative urls only without any query vars.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Is it compatible with other caching plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You must disable any features on your theme or cache plugins which perform minification of css, html and js. Double minification not only slows the whole process, but also has the high potential of causing conflicts in javascript. The plugin will try to automatically purge several popular cache plugins, however if you have a cache on the server side (some hosting services have this) you may need to purge it manually, after you purge FVM to see the results you expect. The automatic purge is active for the following plugins and hosting: W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Cache Enabler, SG Optimizer, Breeze (Cloudways), Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine</p>
</p>
<h4>
Do you recommend a specific Cache Plugin?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Currently we recommend the &#8220;Cache Enabler&#8221; plugin, for it&#8217;s simplicity, compatibility with most systems and performance. Alternatively, W3 Total Cache is a great choice as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Is it resource intensive, or will it use too much CPU on my shared hosting plan?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Unless you are not excluding dynamic CSS files that change the url in every pageload, its not heavy at all. On the first run, each single file is minified into an intermediate cache. When a new group of CSS/JS files is found on a new page, it reuses those files and merges them into a new static cache file. All pages that request the same group of CSS or JS files will also make use of that file, thus regeneration only happens once. In addition, gz and br files will be pre-compressed (if supported).</p>
</p>
<h4>
How do I use the pre-compressed files with gzip_static or brotli_static on Nginx?
</h4>
<p>
<p>When we merge and minify the css and js files, we also create a <code>.gz</code> file to be used with <code>gzip_static</code> on Nginx. You need to enable this feature on your Nginx configuration file if you want to make use of it. Likewise, if you have Nginx compiled with brotli and have enabled the php-ext-brotli extension for PHP, you can enable the brotli_static option and FVM will also generate .br files for you 🙂</p>
</p>
<h4>
Is it compatible with multisites?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it generates a new cache file for every different set of JS and CSS requirements it finds, but you must enable and configure FVM settings for each site in your network separatly (no global settings for all sites).</p>
</p>
<h4>
Is it compatible with AdSense and other ad networks?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If you are just inserting ads on your pages, yes. If you are using a custom script to inject those ads, please double check if it works.</p>
</p>
<h4>
After installing, why are some images, sections, sliders, galleries, menus (etc) not working?
</h4>
<p>
<p>a) You cannot do double minification, so make sure you have disabled any features on your theme or other plugins that perform minification of css, html and js files.</p>
<p>b) If you enabled the option to defer JS or CSS, please note that some themes and plugins need jQuery and other libraries to be render blocking. If you enable the option to defer, any javascript code on the page will trigger an &#8220;undefined&#8221; error on the google chrome console log after page load.</p>
<p>c) The plugin relies on PHP Minify to minify JavaScript and css files, however it is not a perfect library and there are plugins that are already minified and do not output a &#8220;min.js&#8221; or &#8220;min.css&#8221; filename (and end up being minified again). Try to disable minification on JS and CSS files and purge the cache, then either dequeue it and enqueue an alternative file or add it to the ignore list.</p>
<p>d) Sometimes a plugin conflicts with another when merged (look at google chrome console log for hints). Try to disable CSS processing first and see if it works. Disable JS processing second and see if it works. Try to disable HTML minification last and see if it works. If one of those work, you know there is a conflict when merging/minifying.</p>
<p>e) If you have a conflict, try to add each CSS and each JS file to the ignore list one by one, until you find the one that causes the conflict. If you have no idea of which files to add, check the log file on the &#8220;status page&#8221; for a list of files being merged into each generated file.</p>
<p>f) If you coded some inline JS code that depends on a JS file being loaded before it&#8217;s execution (render blocking), try to save that code into an external file and enqueue it as a dependency. It will be merged together and run after the other file, thus no longer being &#8220;undefined&#8221;.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin only processes JS and CSS files enqueued using the official WordPress api method &#8211; https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/including-css-javascript/ -as well as files from the same domain (unless specified on the settings).</p>
</p>
<h4>
Can I merge files from other domains?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and no. You can for example, merge js files such as jQuery if they are loading from a CDN and it will work, because it doesn&#8217;t matter where those files are being served from. However, stuff like Facebook and other social media widgets, as well as tracking codes, widgets and so on, cannot usually be merged and cached locally as they may load something different on every pageload, or anytime they change something. Ads and widgets make your site slow, so make sure you only use the minimum necessary plugins and widgets.</p>
</p>
<h4>
How to undo all changes done by the plugin?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself does not do any &#8220;changes&#8221; to your site and all original files are untouched. It intercepts the enqueued CSS and JS files just before printing your HTML, copies them and enqueues the newly optimized cached version of those files to the frontend. As with any plugin&#8230; simply disable or uninstall the plugin, purge all caches you may have in use (plugins, server, cloudflare, etc.) and the site will go back to what it was before installing it. The plugin does not delete anything from the database or modify any of your files.</p>
</p>
<h4>
I have disabled or deleted the plugin but my design is still broken!
</h4>
<p>
<p>Some &#8220;cheap&#8221; (or sometimes expensive) &#8220;optimized&#8221; hosting providers, implement a (misconfigured) aggressive cache on their servers that caches PHP code execution and PHP files. I&#8217;ve seen people completely deleting all WordPress files from their host via SFTP/FTP and the website kept working fine for hours. Furthermore, very often they rate limit your cache purge requests&#8230; so if you delete FVM and are still seeing references to FVM files on the &#8220;view-source:https://example.com&#8221; please be patient and contact your web hosting to purge all caches. Providers known to have this issue are some plans on hostgator and iPage (please report others if you find them).</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why is my Visual Composer or Page Editor not working?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Some plugins and themes need to edit the layout and styles on the frontend. If you have trouble with page editors, please enable the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; option on FVM and purge your caches. Note: You will only see the FVM minification working when you&#8217;re logged out or using another browser after this setting.</p>
</p>
<h4>
What are the recommended cloudflare settings for this plugin?
</h4>
<p>
<p>On the &#8220;Speed&#8221; tab, deselect the Auto Minify for JavaScript, CSS and HTML as well as the Rocket Loader option as there is no benefit of using them with our plugin (we already minify things). Those options can also break the design due to double minification or the fact that the Rocket Loader is still experimental (you can read about that on the &#8220;Help&#8221; link under each selected option on cloudflare).</p>
</p>
<h4>
How can I load CSS async?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You are probably a developer if you are trying this. The answer is: make sure FVM is only generating 1 CSS file, because &#8220;async&#8221; means multiple files will load out of order (however CSS needs order most of the times). If FVM is generating more than 1 CSS file per mediatype, try to manually dequeue some of the CSS files that are breaking the series on FVM (such as external enqueued files), or add their domain to the settings to be merged together. Please note&#8230; this is an advanced option for skilled developers. Do not try to fiddle with these settings if you are not one, as it will almost certainly break your site layout and functionality.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why is FVM using defer instead of async javascript?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The answer is simple. For compatibility reasons and to avoid some undefined javascript errors, we need to preserve the order of scripts. Async means that any js files will load in parallel without waiting for each other or without following a specific order. If FVM generates multiple JS files for your site, using Async could cause footer scripts to load before the header scripts in an inconsistent manner. By using defer, we make sure the scripts load in order, as defined by each plugin and theme developer.<br />
Your ads or scripts wich are already specifically async will continue to be so, unless you specifically mark them to be merged as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>
I have a complaint or I need support right now.
</h4>
<p>
<p>Before getting angry because you have no answer within a few hours (even with paid plugins, sometimes it takes weeks&#8230;), please be informed about how wordpress.org and the plugins directory work. The plugins directory is an open source, free service where developers and programmers contribute (on their free time) with plugins that can be downloaded and installed by anyone &#8220;at their own risk&#8221; and are all released under the GPL license. While all plugins have to be approved and reviewed by the WordPress team before being published (for dangerous code, spam, etc.) this does not change the license or add any warranty. All plugins are provided as they are, free of charge and should be used at your own risk (so you should make backups before installing any plugin or performing updates) and it is your sole responsibility if you break your site after installing a plugin from the plugins directory. For a full version of the license, please read: https://wordpress.org/about/gpl/</p>
</p>
<h4>
Why haven&#8217;t you replied to my topic on the support forum yet?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Support is provided by plugin authors on their free time and without warranty of a reply, so you can experience different levels of support level from plugin to plugin. As the author of this plugin I strive to provide support on a daily basis and I can take a look and help you with some issues related with my plugin, but please note that this is done out of my goodwill and in no way I have any legal or moral obligation for doing this. Sometimes I am extremely busy and may take a few days to reply, but I will always reply.</p>
</p>
<h4>
But I really need fast support right now, is there any other way?
</h4>
<p>
<p>I am also available for hiring if you need custom-made speed optimizations. After you have installed the plugin, check the &#8220;Help&#8221; tab for contact information, or check my profile links here on WordPress.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Where can I report bugs?
</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get support on the official WordPress plugin page at https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/fast-velocity-minify<br />
Alternatively, you can reach me via info (at) fastvelocity.com for security or other vulnerabilities.</p>
</p>
<h4>
How can I donate to the plugin author?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If you would like to donate any amount to the plugin author (thank you in advance), you can do it via PayPal at https://goo.gl/vpLrSV</p>
</p>

nify.2.8.6.zip";s:5:"2.8.7";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.8.7.zip";s:5:"2.8.8";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.8.8.zip";s:5:"2.8.9";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.8.9.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:2:"1x";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/icon-128x128.jpg?rev=1440946";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:25:"Podlove Podcast Publisher";s:4:"slug";s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";s:7:"version";s:5:"3.2.2";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/eteubert";s:8:"requires";s:3:"5.2";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.6.0";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"7.0";s:6:"rating";i:90;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:30;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:36;s:15:"support_threads";i:5;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:243142;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2020-12-14 7:51pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-06-26";s:8:"homepage";s:28:"http://publisher.podlove.org";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3522:"<p>We built the Podlove Podcast Publisher because existing solutions are stuck in the past, complex and unwieldy. The Publisher helps you save time, worry less and provides a cutting edge listening experience for your audience.</p>
<p>Official Site: <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">publisher.podlove.org</a></p>
<h4>Video Tutorial: Getting started with Podlove Publisher</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='640' height='360' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hmrm-jUe6u4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;fs=1&#038;hl=en-US&#038;autohide=2&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;' sandbox='allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-popups allow-presentation'></iframe></span>
<h4>Compatible Feeds</h4>
<p>The Publisher makes it easy to create highly expressive, efficient and super compatible podcast feeds with fine grained control over client behavior (e.g. GUID control to replace faulty episodes and for clients to reload) supporting all important meta data.</p>
<h4>Multi-Format Publishing</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes multi-format publishing &#8211; embracing all modern and legacy audio and video codecs &#8211; a snap. By adopting simple file name conventions, the plugin allows the podcaster to provide individual feeds for certain use cases or audiences without adding work for the podcaster during the publishing process.</p>
<h4>Optimized Web Player</h4>
<p>The Publisher also comes with integrated with the Podlove Web Player plugin (which you do not need to install separately) and fully support its advanced options including multiple audio (MP4 AAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus) and video (MP4 H.264, WebM, Theora) format support for web browsers. This Web Player is fully HTML5 compatible (but provides Flash fallback for ancient environments) and is ready for all touch based clients too.</p>
<h4>Chapter Support</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes it easy to publish chapter information in the player to make access to structured episodes even easier. Full support for linking directly to any part of your podcast on the web with instant playback included.</p>
<h4>Flexible Templates</h4>
<p>To round it all up, a flexible template system enables you to published Podcasts in a defined fashion and change the style at any time without having to touch your individual postings later on.</p>
<p>And this is just the beginning. We have a rich roadmap that will bring even more interesting features: integration with helpful services, much improved timeline metadata support (show notes) and much more.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Publisher</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Project</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a></li>
<li><a href="http://docs.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues" rel="nofollow ugc">Bug Tracker</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/donations/" rel="nofollow ugc">Donate</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Development of the plugin is an open process. The current version is available <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow ugc">on GitHub</a> Feel free to contribute and to fix errors or send improvements via GitHub.</p>
<p>Requires PHP 5.4+</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:410:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2003:"
<h4>
Is Podlove Podcast Publisher free?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The core features of Podlove Podcast Publisher are and always will be free. <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow ugc">Paid Professional Support</a> is available but not necessary to run the plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Are there Download Statistics?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Podcast Downloads can be tracked and analyzed. You can easily see how many people downloaded you podcast episodes, which clients they used, if they prefer to subscribe to the feed or listen on your website using the web player—and much more.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Are there Privacy / GDPR considerations?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Podlove Publisher is GDPR compliant and provides prewritten text snippets for your privacy page. See https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-publisher/guides/dsgvo-gdpr.html</p>
</p>
<h4>
Where can I host my podcast files?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Any storage where you have control over the file naming is compatible with Podlove Podcast Publisher. You can manage files using a simple FTP/sFTP or use services like Amazon S3.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Where can I ask questions and get support?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Free support where questions are answered by the community is available in the <a href="http://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community Forum</a>. There is a German community in the <a href="https://sendegate.de/" rel="nofollow ugc">Sendegate</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>
How can I help the project?
</h4>
<p>
<p>The continued success of Open Source project relies on the community. There are many ways you can help:</p>
<ul>
<li>If you enjoy the plugin, please <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/reviews/#new-post">leave a review</a>.</li>
<li>You can answer questions of other fellow podcasters in the <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p>This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:8687:"<h4>3.2.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: crash when creating new episodes</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: coverart url encoding <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1181" rel="nofollow ugc">#1181</a></li>
<li>fix: some settings not applying to episode title tag (thanks Dirk)</li>
<li>fix: crash when accessing season data for an episode without season</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>when automatically generated episode titles are used, use the blogpost title as fallback for the episode title</li>
<li>fix: disable slug auto-updating after importing from Auphonic</li>
<li>fix: webvtt-parser autoloading issues <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1175" rel="nofollow ugc">#1175</a></li>
<li>fix: escape ampersands in itunes:image hrefs in the feed <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1176" rel="nofollow ugc">#1176</a> (fixes incompatibilities with Jetpack image CDN)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.*</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix twig namespace prefixing related issues</li>
<li>remove unused vendor-bin directory from releases</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>tracking: fix operating systems appearing twice in different spellings</li>
<li>chore: prefix all composer packages (solves Twig related incompatibilities &amp; crashes)</li>
<li>chore: add content and files to episodes api (#1165)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>analytics: new chart showing download development from episode to episode <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1100/files" rel="nofollow ugc">#1100</a> thanks <a href="https://github.com/poschi3" rel="nofollow ugc">@poschi3</a>!</li>
<li>Auphonic: show production warnings in module (https://twitter.com/auphonic/status/1305849345762185217)</li>
<li>download tracking: use OPAWG podcast user agent database in addition to Matomo database</li>
<li>stability: detect plugins using older/incompatible versions of Twig. Display a warning on the site (instead of an error) and a detailed explanation on &#8220;Podlove &gt; Support&#8221; screen.</li>
<li>enhance: podcast file validation in dashboard includes all post stati and checks for missing slug <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1161" rel="nofollow ugc">#1161</a></li>
<li>enhance: only allow episode numbers of 0 and higher in form input <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1158" rel="nofollow ugc">#1158</a></li>
<li>api: add public endpoint for transcripts</li>
<li>api: add public endpoint for shownotes</li>
<li>fix: Podlove Web Player 5 includes all downloadable assets in download section</li>
<li>fix: transcript API URL <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1145" rel="nofollow ugc">#1145</a> thanks <a href="https://github.com/gibso" rel="nofollow ugc">gibso</a>!</li>
<li>fix: editing/deleting shows (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1077" rel="nofollow ugc">#1077</a>)</li>
<li>fix: episodes and shows API</li>
<li>fix: migration for Shownotes only when the database table exists</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: contributor notifications settings can be saved again (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1144" rel="nofollow ugc">#1144</a>)</li>
<li>fix: do not include invisible contributors in Web Player 5 API (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1142" rel="nofollow ugc">#1142</a>)</li>
<li>fix: detect Yoast SEO, wpSEO: disables Open Graph module (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1132" rel="nofollow ugc">#1132</a>)</li>
<li>fix: use podcast summary as RSS Feed <code>&lt;description&gt;</code> if subtitle is not set (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1092" rel="nofollow ugc">#1092</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: title escaping in RSS feed when using native (not auto-generated) titles</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>add: Untappd social service</li>
<li>fix: Auphonic module (wrong HTTP API headers)</li>
<li>chore: update npm dependencies</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: escaping issue in RSS feed (itunes:author and itunes:owner)</li>
<li>fix: remove (rare) accidental double enclosure tag in RSS feed when &#8220;enclosure&#8221; post meta is present</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.0.0</h4>
<p><strong>Breaking Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>requires PHP 7.0 (or newer)</li>
<li>requires WordPress 5.2 (or newer)</li>
<li>Web Player:
<ul>
<li>removes Podlove Web Player 2</li>
<li>removes Podlove Web Player 3</li>
<li>removes &#8220;insert player automatically&#8221; option (probably does not affect anyone as the web player is by default inserted via template)</li>
<li>removes &#8220;Chapters Visibility&#8221; option (use dedicated Web Player settings instead)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>New Publisher PLUS</strong></p>
<p>=&gt; <a href="https://plus.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">plus.podlove.org</a></p>
<p>Publisher PLUS is a new service providing Feed Proxy and Podcast Subscriber statistics for Podlove Publisher.</p>
<p>To use it, enable the <em>Publisher PLUS</em> module, then visit <a href="https://plus.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">plus.podlove.org</a> to create an account.</p>
<p>Subscriber Statistics are only the beginning. Expect more features soon!</p>
<p><strong>Experimental: Shownotes</strong></p>
<p>Generate and manage episode show notes. Helps you provide rich metadata for URLs. Full support for Publisher Templates.</p>
<p>This module is a work-in-progress. But it&#8217;s usable, so feel free to give it a try, especially if your shownotes are link-heavy and you&#8217;re comfortable writing Podlove (Twig) templates.</p>
<p>The module is currently hidden. Make it visible by setting a PHP constant, for example in your <code>wp-config.php</code>: <code>define('PODLOVE_MODULE_SHOWNOTES_VISBLE', true);</code>.</p>
<p>Use this template as a starting point: https://gist.github.com/eteubert/d6c51c52372dc2da2f1734a5f54c7918</p>
<p><strong>Shortcodes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>podlove-episode-contributor-list</code>
<ul>
<li>new design</li>
<li>renders text-only in RSS feed</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>podlove-podcast-contributor-list</code>
<ul>
<li>new design</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><code>podlove-episode-downloads</code>
<ul>
<li>the text link variant is now the default style</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Miscellaneous</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>remove Bitlove module (service does not exist any more)</li>
<li>remove Flattr module</li>
<li>remove &#8220;Website Protocol&#8221; setting (not necessary any more as Let&#8217;s Encrypt is widely supported)</li>
<li>enable episode chapters by default</li>
<li>convenience: &#8220;Copy to Clipboard&#8221; function for Podlove Template shortcodes</li>
<li>expose iTunes id/URL in podcast feed (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1078" rel="nofollow ugc">#1078</a>)</li>
<li>improve feed rendering: use XML generator for all tags with user input to guarantee valid feeds for all inputs</li>
<li>add function to remove a transcript from an episode (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1131" rel="nofollow ugc">#1131</a>)</li>
<li>add Steady as donation service</li>
<li>add template tag: <code>episode.post_title</code> (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1136" rel="nofollow ugc">#1136</a>)</li>
<li>add template tag: <code>service.type</code> (https://community.podlove.org/t/replacing-social-icons/2321)</li>
<li>add default avatar to transcript preview</li>
<li>fix: search logic (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1072" rel="nofollow ugc">#1072</a>)</li>
<li>fix: fetch Podlove News via https (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1037" rel="nofollow ugc">#1037</a>)</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t send Publisher logs to system log when WP_DEBUG is on (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1065" rel="nofollow ugc">#1065</a>)</li>
<li>fix: ensure uploads for webvtt (transcripts) and gz (exports) are allowed</li>
<li>fix: ensure contributors module is active when transcripts are used</li>
<li>fix: ensure permissions in shownotes and transcripts APIs</li>
<li>fix: don&#8217;t count download requests with http range header of <code>bytes=0-0</code> (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1135" rel="nofollow ugc">#1135</a>)</li>
<li>update dependencies</li>
<li>build releases with GitHub Actions (in favour of TravisCI)</li>
</ul>
<p>Changes for previous versions can be found in the <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/blob/master/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow ugc"><code>changelog.txt</code></a>.</p>

4:01pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-07-03";s:8:"homepage";s:44:"https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-web-player/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:3168:"<p>Podlove Web Player is a HTML5 based web player for audio and video media files that is optimized and extended for the specific needs of podcasters.<br />
It has a native integration with <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a>, can be used as a shortcode and also plays well with Gutenberg Blocks.</p>
<h3>Made for Podcasters</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Chapters</li>
<li>Transcripts</li>
<li>Sharing &amp; Embedding</li>
<li>Download integrated</li>
<li>Audio Controls, including playback speed</li>
<li>Supports multiple audio file formats</li>
<li>Supports live streams</li>
</ul>
<h3>Theming &amp; Templating</h3>
<p>The Player is fully customizable in terms of</p>
<ul>
<li>Theme colors</li>
<li>Font family and weight</li>
<li>Templates and appearance</li>
</ul>
<h3>Subscribe Button Integration</h3>
<ul>
<li>Customizable Podcast Clients</li>
<li>Integration in the Player</li>
</ul>
<h3>Usage</h3>
<p>There are basically four ways to use the Podlove Web Player:</p>
<h4>1 Manual WordPress Shortcode</h4>
<p>Use a simple shortcode in your posts and pages, and the Podlove Web Player will appear, playing any media file you want to assign. Basic usage:</p>
<p>[podlove-web-player<br />
  theme=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  config=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  title=&#8221;My episode title&#8221;<br />
  subtitle=&#8221;Episode Subtitle&#8221;<br />
  poster=&#8221;/files/path/to/poster.png&#8221;<br />
  chapters=&#8221;/files/path/to/chapters.json&#8221;<br />
  transcripts=&#8221;/files/path/to/transcripts.json&#8221;<br />
  playlist=&#8221;/files/path/to/playlist.json&#8221;<br />
  src=&#8221;http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3&#8243;<br />
  size=&#8221;1337&#8243;<br />
  show=&#8221;My show title&#8221;<br />
  duration=&#8221;03:33&#8243;<br />
]</p>
<p>Use an existing post with a media enclosure that is provided from plugins like Blubrry:</p>
<p>[podlove-web-player<br />
  theme=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  config=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  post=&#8221;1234&#8243;<br />
]</p>
<p>Or in case you have our <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/">Podlove Publisher</a> installed:</p>
<p>[podlove-web-player<br />
  theme=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  config=&#8221;default&#8221;<br />
  publisher=&#8221;1234&#8243;<br />
]</p>
<h4>2 Using WordPress Gutenberg Blocks</h4>
<p>You can choose between different references, like Podlove Publisher, Blocks or you can add the meta data manually. Right now the latter option is limited to a limited set of attributes, this will be expanded in further releases.</p>
<h4>3 Automatic Integration with Podcasting Engines</h4>
<p>If you are using Podlove Publisher you should be able to select it in the Publisher Player settings.<br />
In case you are still using Blubrry you can simply enable the automatic insertions on enclosures in the settings and choose the position.</p>
<h3>Help &amp; Support</h3>
<p>If you encounter any issue with the plugin or want to request a specific feature please reach out to our <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow ugc">Podlove Community</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:411:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Web Player Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:9:"changelog";s:10576:"<h4>5.4.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove conditonal loading due to WordPress quirkyness :/</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improve page performance by only adding scripts on pages with a player</li>
<li>Harden lifecycle, only render player once all scripts are available (this may lead to slower page rendering)</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix PHP warnings</li>
<li>Minimize cache.js size</li>
<li>Only add api requests to cache</li>
</ul>

<li>Brings back show tag for shortcode</li>

<li>CSS improvements</li>

<li>added “timecontrolsVisible” parameter</li>
<li>added “summaryVisible” parameter</li>
<li>added sample audio files for testing purposes</li>
<li>fresh versions of mediaelementjs and jQuery</li>
</ul>

<li>added: Rich player with meta information (title, subtitle, summary, cover image)</li>
<li>added: Opus audio codec support</li>

<li>added: optional listening to WordPress enclosures</li>
<li>new settings area</li>

</ul>

</ul>

<ul>
<li>First proper release.</li>
<li>[audio] and [video] are deprecated: Use [podloveaudio] and [podlovevideo] instead!</li>
<li>Implements W3C Media Fragements with start and end time</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>First version on wordpress.org</li>
<li>Full of bugs</li>
</ul>

ress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.0.8.zip";s:5:"5.0.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.0.9.zip";s:5:"5.1.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.0.zip";s:5:"5.1.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.1.zip";s:5:"5.1.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.1.2.zip";s:5:"5.2.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.0.zip";s:5:"5.2.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.1.zip";s:5:"5.2.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.2.zip";s:5:"5.2.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.3.zip";s:5:"5.2.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.4.zip";s:5:"5.2.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.5.zip";s:5:"5.2.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.6.zip";s:5:"5.2.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.7.zip";s:5:"5.2.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.8.zip";s:5:"5.2.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.2.9.zip";s:5:"5.3.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.3.0.zip";s:5:"5.3.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.3.1.zip";s:5:"5.4.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.0.zip";s:5:"5.4.1";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.1.zip";s:5:"5.4.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.2.zip";s:5:"5.4.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.3.zip";s:5:"5.4.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.4.zip";s:5:"5.4.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.5.zip";s:5:"5.4.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.6.zip";s:5:"5.4.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.7.zip";s:5:"5.4.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.5.4.8.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"https://podlove.org/donations";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=2286308";s:2:"2x";s:71:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=2286308";s:3:"svg";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=2286308";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:24:"Podlove Subscribe button";s:4:"slug";s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.3.7";s:6:"author";s:41:"<a href="https://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.3.6";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:24417;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2019-10-31 10:24pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-04-15";s:8:"homepage";s:62:"https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/podlove-subscribe-button/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2037:"<p>This plugin allows easy inclusion of the Podlove Subscribe Button. Put it in your sidebar with a simple widget or include the button in pages and/or posts with a simple shortcode.</p>
<h3>About the Podlove Subscribe Button</h3>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button allows for simple subscription of podcasts in anybody&#8217;s favorite podcast app right from the browser without having to deal with pesky feed URLs and go on a hunt for feed subscription dialogues.</p>
<p>The button knows how to activate the subscription functionality in all popular podcast apps supporting various operating systems including but not limited to iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, OSX, Windows and Linux.</p>
<p>The button is centrally hosted and gets permanently updated when new podcast apps emerge or when new features are added. Using the button ensures your podcast can easily be subscribed to and presents an ever more popular user interface that your audience gets more and more used to.</p>
<h3>About Podlove</h3>
<p>Podlove is an open source initiative to improve the overall podcasting infrastructure and to come up with simple but helpful standards and tools to make publishing and listening to podcast as easy as possible.</p>
<p>Podlove currently provides:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://publisher.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Podcast Publisher</em></strong></a> &#8211; a powerful plugin for WordPress for podcasters to publish metadata-rich podcasts</li>
<li><strong><em>Podlove Web Player</em></strong> &#8211; a podcast-optimized HTML5 web player with chapter support</li>
<li><a href="https://subscribe-button.podlove.org" rel="nofollow ugc"><strong><em>Podlove Subscribe Button</em></strong></a> &#8211; a centrally hosted universal podcast subscribe button for the web</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podlove Project: https://podlove.org/</li>
<li>Podlove Community: https://community.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Documentation: https://docs.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Donate: https://podlove.org/donations/</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:4139:"<h3>Install the plugin</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<h3>Configure buttons</h3>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Settings &gt; Podlove Subscribe Button</code></li>
<li>Fill out all fields, save and grab the shortcode</li>
<li>Add the button to your blog using the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button id="{{yourButtonID}}"]</code> with your button ID, or use the provided Podlove Subscribe Button Widget</li>
</ol>
<h3>Display the Subscribe Button in your Sidebar using a Widget</h3>
<p>Go to <code>Appearance -&gt; Widgets</code> and drag the &#8220;Podlove Subscribe Button&#8221; widget to your sidebar configuration. Select the pre-configured button from the list and determine which style you want. That&#8217;s it. The button should show up in your sidebar. Optionally add a title and description for your widget.</p>
<p>This is the easiest and recommended way of using this plugin especially if you ony want to display a button for a single podcast. For best visibility choose size &#8220;big&#8221; and format &#8220;cover&#8221; to make your Subscribe Button stand out and easily locatable.</p>
<h3>Include the Subscribe Button in WordPress pages using a Shortcode</h3>
<p>If you want to include a Podlove Subscribe Button in a WordPress page (or a post) just put the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> at the desired position in your text. Use the following shortcode parameters to configure it properly:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>button</code> &#8211; the ID of one of your preconfigured buttons</li>
<li><code>size</code> &#8211; one of &#8216;small&#8217;, &#8216;medium&#8217;, &#8216;big&#8217;</li>
<li><code>width</code> &#8211; specify desired button width in CSS compatibles values or &#8216;auto&#8217; automatic width depending on context.</li>
<li><code>color</code> &#8211; specify the color of the button in a CSS compatible format (keyword, rgb-hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla)</li>
<li><code>style</code> &#8211; default is filled, options are &#8216;outline&#8217; and &#8216;frameless&#8217;</li>
<li><code>format</code> &#8211; default is a rectangle, options are &#8216;square&#8217; and &#8216;cover&#8217; (<strong>Note</strong>: &#8216;cover&#8217; has a max size of 300px)</li>
<li><code>hide</code> &#8211; if set to <code>true</code> the button will not be shown (useful if you want to use your own element)</li>
<li><code>language</code> &#8211; specify the language the texts on the button and popup should be in (currently supports &#8216;de&#8217;, &#8216;en&#8217;, &#8216;eo&#8217;, &#8216;fi&#8217;, &#8216;fr&#8217;, &#8216;nl&#8217;, &#8216;zh&#8217; and &#8216;ja&#8217;)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note that if you do not provide one of the attributes the subscribe button will use the globally set default.</p>
<h3>Shortcode Examples</h3>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton1" size="big"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a large button with the podcast logo on top using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton1&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton2" size="medium" width="100pt" language="de"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small button with a width of 100pt using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton2&#8221; in german. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton3" size="big" width="auto" format="cover"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a big button with a the podcast cover and automatically adjusted using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton3&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton4" format="square" style="frameless"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small, frameless square button with using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton4&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1367:"
<h4>I&#8217;m running the Podlove Publisher. Do I need this plugin to display a Subscribe button?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and No. If you simply want to display a Subscribe Button for your Podcast you publish with the Podlove Publisher you do not need this plugin as the Publisher itself provides this functionality. If you want to display multiple Subscribe Buttons you can use the Subscribe Button plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I create those &#8220;Network-wide&#8221; Buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find the Panel in the Networks Settings Section</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin actually contain the code for the button?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. This plugin just embeds the code that is needed to display the Podlove Subscribe Button. The button itself is served live from api.podlove.org</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I update the plugin to get support for more clients?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. As the Podlove Subscribe Button is hosted centrally, it gets updated regularly independent from this pugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>I am a podcast app developer and would like my app be listed in the button. What do I need to do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Consult the information provided on <a href="https://podlove.org/podlove-subscribe-button" rel="nofollow ugc">the technical information page</a> at podlove.org on how the button works and what app developers need to support and do in order to get listed in the button.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:2490:"<h3>1.3.7 (2019-07-20)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED an issue that prevented the subscribe button to appear</li>
<li>FIXED a XSS vulnerability</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.6 (2018-10-02)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED autowidth value not saving to options correctly</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.5 (2018-09-09)</h3>
<ul>
<li>Replaced the spectrum color selector with WP Color Picker</li>
<li>FIXED multiple color pickers when adding a widget</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.4 (unreleased)</h3>
<ul>
<li>FIXED detection of Publisher plugin (widget naming)</li>
<li>FIXED deprecated WP core functions removed</li>
<li>FIXED fix select button for widget</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced Support for translation</li>
<li>Fixed an issue that prevented network buttons to be shown</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed an error that caused notices on some installations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed an error that caused fatal errors on some installations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podcast Cover Image can be selected using the WordPress Media Library</li>
<li>When using the Shortcode, the button language can now be set using the language attribute</li>
<li>Enhanced support for button color</li>
<li>Fixed a bug that caused an error message for non-network installations</li>
<li>UI enhancements and further optimizations</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.2.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Various bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Added various options that allow customization of the Subscribe button</li>
<li>Various bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.1.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Various bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.1.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Remove duplicate <code>wp-admin/</code> from Network-Settings URL</li>
<li>Check for old PHP versions before plugin is activated</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.1.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Smaller Bugfix: Build tables on plugin-activation only</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Network Support &#8211; If you run a WordPress Multisite Installation you can create network-wide available Buttons</li>
<li>Default Settings for Size and Autowidth</li>
<li>UI enhancements</li>
</ul>
<h3>1.0.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Enhancements in documentation</li>
<li>Smaller Bugfixes</li>
<li>Shortcodes: Change <code>id</code> attribute to <code>button</code></li>
</ul>
<h3>1.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Initial Release</li>
<li>Settings page to allow definition of preconfigured buttons</li>
<li>WordPress Widget to show preconfigured buttons in WordPress Sidebar</li>
<li>WordPress Shortcode [podlove-subscribe-button] to insert preconfigured buttons in pages and articles</li>
</ul>

needs.";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:6:"button";s:6:"button";s:4:"feed";s:4:"feed";s:7:"podcast";s:7:"podcast";s:7:"podlove";s:7:"podlove";s:9:"subscribe";s:9:"subscribe";}s:8:"versions";a:16:{s:3:"1.0";s:71:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.0.zip";s:5:"1.0.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.0.1.zip";s:3:"1.1";s:71:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.2";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.1.3";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.1.3.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:71:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.2.zip";s:5:"1.2.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.2.1.zip";s:3:"1.3";s:71:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.1";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.1.zip";s:5:"1.3.2";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.2.zip";s:5:"1.3.3";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.5";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.5.zip";s:5:"1.3.6";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.6.zip";s:5:"1.3.7";s:73:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.1.3.7.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-subscribe-button.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:71:"https://flattr.com/thing/728463/Podlove-Podcasting-Plugin-for-WordPress";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:69:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-subscribe-button/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545649";s:2:"2x";s:77:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-subscribe-button/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545649";s:3:"svg";s:69:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-subscribe-button/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545649";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:7:"markets";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:12:"antispam-bee";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:12:"Antispam Bee";s:4:"slug";s:12:"antispam-bee";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.9.3";s:6:"author";s:57:"<a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org">pluginkollektiv</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:46:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/pluginkollektiv";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:3:"5.6";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.2";s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:162;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:174;s:15:"support_threads";i:9;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:8;s:10:"downloaded";i:3960386;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2020-12-02 11:50am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-01-10";s:8:"homepage";s:40:"https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2482:"<p>Say Goodbye to comment spam on your WordPress blog or website. <em>Antispam Bee</em> blocks spam comments and trackbacks effectively, without captchas and without sending personal information to third party services. It is free of charge, ad-free and 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<h3>Feature/Settings Overview</h3>
<ul>
<li>Trust approved commenters.</li>
<li>Trust commenters with a Gravatar.</li>
<li>Consider the comment time.</li>
<li>Allow comments only in a certain language.</li>
<li>Block or allow commenters from certain countries.</li>
<li>Treat BBCode links as spam.</li>
<li>Validate the IP address of commenters.</li>
<li>Use regular expressions.</li>
<li>Search local spam database for commenters previously marked as spammers.</li>
<li>Notify admins by e-mail about incoming spam.</li>
<li>Delete existing spam after n days.</li>
<li>Limit approval to comments/pings (will delete other comment types).</li>
<li>Select spam indicators to send comments to deletion directly.</li>
<li>Optionally exclude trackbacks and pingbacks from spam detection.</li>
<li>Optionally spam-check comment forms on archive pages.</li>
<li>Display spam statistics on the dashboard, including daily updates of spam detection rate and a total of blocked spam comments.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li>Community support via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums on wordpress.org</a></li>
<li>Read <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/documentation/" rel="nofollow ugc">the documentation</a></li>
<li>We don’t handle support via e-mail, Twitter, GitHub issues etc.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<ul>
<li>Active development of this plugin is handled <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow ugc">on GitHub</a>.</li>
<li>Pull requests for documented bugs are highly appreciated.</li>
<li>If you think you’ve found a bug (e.g. you’re experiencing unexpected behavior), please post at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee">support forums</a> first.</li>
<li>If you want to help us translate this plugin you can do so <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow ugc">on WordPress Translate</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<ul>
<li>Author: <a href="https://sergejmueller.github.io/" rel="nofollow ugc">Sergej Müller</a></li>
<li>Maintainers: <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org" rel="nofollow ugc">pluginkollektiv</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:558:"<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow ugc">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 4.5 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:2923:"
<h4>
Does Antispam Bee prevents spam registrations or protects form plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It does not help to protect form plugins and does not prevent spam registrations. Hopefully we can provide better hooks for third party plugins to use Antispam Bee to fill this gap in the forthcoming new major version.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Does Antispam Bee work with Jetpack, Disqus Comments and other comment plugins?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It is not compatible with Jetpack or Disqus Comments as those plugins load the comment form within an iframe. Thus Antispam Bee can not access the comment form directly.<br />
It also won’t work with any AJAX-powered comment forms.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Does Antispam Bee store any private user data, and is it compliant with GDPR?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee is developed in Europe. You might have heard we can be a bit nitpicky over here when it comes to privacy. The plugin does not save private user data and is 100% compliant with GDPR.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Will I have to edit any theme templates to get Antispam Bee to work?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, the plugin works as is. You may want to configure your favorite settings, though.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Does Antispam Bee work with shortened IPs?
</h4>
<p>
<p>Generally yes. However, commissioning the Antispam Bee plugin for canceled or shortened IP addresses in comment metadata is not recommended. Because the name and the e-mail address of the comments are not unique, an IP address is the only reliable measure. The more complete the stored IP addresses, the more reliable the assignment or detection of spam.</p>
</p>
<h4>
How can I submit undetected spam?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If the antispam plugin has passed some spam comments, these comments can be reported for analysis. A <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/ITzVHXkLVL" rel="nofollow ugc">Google table</a> was created for this purpose.</p>
</p>
<h4>
Antispam Bee with Varnish?
</h4>
<p>
<p>If WordPress is operated with Apache + Varnish, the actual IP address of the visitors does not appear in WordPress. Accordingly the Antispam-Plugin lacks the base for the correct functionality. An adaptation in the Varnish configuration file /etc/varnish/default.vcl provides a remedy and forwards the original (not from Apache) IP address in the HTTP header X-Forwarded-For:</p>
<blockquote>
<p>if (req.restarts == 0) {<br />
      set req.http.X-Forwarded-For = client.ip;<br />
  }</p>
</blockquote>
</p>
<h4>
Are there some paid services or limitations?
</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Antispam Bee is free forever, for both private and commercial projects. You can use it on as many sites as you want. There is no limitation to the number of sites you use the plugin on.</p>
<p>A complete documentation is available on <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/documentation/" rel="nofollow ugc">pluginkollektiv.org</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:7266:"<h3>2.9.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with WordPress 5.5</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined index on spam list page</li>
<li>Tweak: Better wording on settings page</li>
<li>Tweak: AMP compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak: Protect CSS from overwrite through bad themes</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Delete comment meta for deleted old spam. For the cleanup of older orphaned comment meta we suggest the usage of <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-sweep/">WP Sweep</a></li>
<li>Fix: Statistic in dashboard showed wrong value</li>
<li>Tweak: Change autocomplete attribute to &#8220;new-password&#8221;</li>
<li>Tweak: Autoptimize compatibility improved</li>
<li>Tweak: Renamed blacklist/whitelist to a better phrase</li>
<li>Tweak: Added new pattern</li>
<li>Tweak: UI and text optimizations</li>
<li>Tweak: Better compatibility with some server configurations</li>
<li>Tweak: Make spam reason sortable and filterable</li>
<li>Tweak: Add spam reason for manually marked spam</li>
<li>Maintenance: Deleted unused code</li>
<li>Maintenance: Removed Fake IP check (unreliable and producing false positives)</li>
<li>Maintenance: Fix some coding standard issues</li>
<li>Maintenance: Tested up to WordPress 5.4</li>
<li>Maintenance: Tested up to PHP 7.4</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improved backend accessibility</li>
<li>Prefilled comment textareas do now work with the honeypot</li>
<li>Compatible with the AMP plugin (https://wordpress.org/plugins/amp/)</li>
<li>Improved dashboard tooltips</li>
<li>Improvements for the language detection API</li>
<li>Scalable IP look up for local spam database</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.9.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Introduction of coding standards.</li>
<li>Switch to franc language detection API for the language check.</li>
<li>Do not longer overwrite the IP address WordPress saves with the comment by using <code>pre_comment_user_ip</code>.</li>
<li>Do not show &#8220;Trust commenters with a Gravatar&#8221; if the &#8220;Show Gravatar&#8221; option is not set.</li>
<li>Skip the checks, when I ping myself.</li>
<li>Fixes some wrong usages of the translation functions.</li>
<li>Use the regular expressions check also for trackbacks.</li>
<li>Add option to delete Antispam Bee related data when plugin gets deleted via the admin interface.</li>
<li>Save a hashed + salted IP for every comment</li>
<li>New check for incoming trackbacks.</li>
<li>Introduction of behat tests.</li>
<li>Updates the used JavaScript library for the statistics widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix in the &#8220;Comment form used outside of posts&#8221; option.</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.3 compatibility</li>
<li>Bugfix where a spam trackback produced a fatal error</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/8?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removed stopforumspam.com to avoid potential GDPR violation</li>
<li>Improves IP handling to comply with GDPR</li>
<li>Improves PHP7.2 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixes small bug on mobile views</li>
<li>Allow more than one language in language check</li>
<li>Minor interface improvements</li>
<li>Remove old russian and Dutch translation files</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/4?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixes an incompatibility with Chrome autofill</li>
<li>Fixes some incompatibilities with other plugins/themes where the comment field was left empty</li>
<li>Support for RTL</li>
<li>Solve some translation/language issues</li>
<li>A new filter to add languages to the language check</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/6?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Country check is back again (thanks to Sergej Müller for his amazing work and the service page)</li>
<li>Improved Honeypot</li>
<li>Language check through Google Translate API is back again (thanks to Simon Kraft of https://moenus.net/ for offering to cover the costs)</li>
<li>More default Regexes</li>
<li>Unit Test Framework</li>
<li>Accessibility and GUI improvements</li>
<li>An <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow ugc">english documentation</a> is now available, too. Some corrections in the german documentation.</li>
<li>Some bugfixes &#8211; Among other things for WPML compatibility</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/3?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.9</h3>
<ul>
<li>Updates donation links throughout the plugin</li>
<li>Fixes an error were JavaScript on the dashboard was erroneously being enqueued</li>
<li>Ensures compatibility with the latest WordPress version</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.8</h3>
<ul>
<li>added a POT file</li>
<li>updated German translation, added formal version</li>
<li>updated plugin text domain to include a dash instead of an underscore</li>
<li>updated, translated + formatted README.md</li>
<li>updated expired link URLs in plugin and languages files</li>
<li>updated <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org/hello-world/" rel="nofollow ugc">plugin authors</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.7</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removal of functions <em>Block comments from specific countries</em> and <em>Allow comments only in certain language</em> for financial reasons &#8211; <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/news/2015/removal-of-allow-comments-only-in-certain-language/" rel="nofollow ugc">more information</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.6</h3>

<li>Switch to the official Google Translation API</li>

</ul>
<h3>2.6.5</h3>

</ul>
<h3>2.6.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Consideration of the comment time (Spam if a comment was written in less than 5 seconds) &#8211; <a href="https://antispambee.pluginkollektiv.org/news/2014/antispam-bee-2-6-4/" rel="nofollow ugc">more information</a></li>

</ul>
<h3>2.6.3</h3>
